availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas J. Kerby (Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer and captain)

body.p: Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Julia P. Kerby. Father of Sidney W. Kerby, Columbus W. Kerby, Nancy A. Kerby, Geraldine Kerby, Eugene G. Kerby. Farmer in Caney, Ohio County in 1860. Served in 17th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain from January 4, 1862, to March 12, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio, Caney, p. 152.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio, Sulphur Springs, p. 514.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 966.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 398.
